009package Ch21_GeometricOperations;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.AffineMapping2D;
018import imagingbook.common.image.ImageMapper;
019import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
020import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
021import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
022
023/**
024 * Demo plugin showing how to specify an affine transformation from
025 * a pair of triangles (point arrays).
026 * Also illustrates the use of {@link ImageMapper}.
027 * 
028 * @author WB
029 *
030 * @see AffineMapping2D
031 * @see ImageMapper
032 */
033public class Map_Affine_Triangles implements PlugInFilter {
034
035    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
036        return DOES_ALL;
037    }
038
039    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
040        Pnt2d[] P = {                   // source triangle
041                        PntInt.from(0, 0),
042                        PntInt.from(400, 0),
043                        PntInt.from(400, 400)
044        };
045
046        Pnt2d[] Q = {                   // target triangle
047                        PntInt.from(0, 60),
048                        PntInt.from(400, 20),
049                        PntInt.from(300, 400)
050        };
051
052                // inverse mapping (target to source):
053        AffineMapping2D m = AffineMapping2D.fromPoints(P, Q);   // forward mapping P -> Q
054                AffineMapping2D mi = m.getInverse();                                    // inverse mapping Q -> P
055                new ImageMapper(mi, OutOfBoundsStrategy.ZeroValues, InterpolationMethod.Bicubic).map(ip);
056                
057                IJ.log("A = \n" + Matrix.toString(m.getTransformationMatrix()));
058    }
059}
